definitions.definition: an entertaining activity or sport, especially one played by children, or the equipment needed for such an activity:
a particular competition, match, or occasion when people play a game:
one part of a competition in activities such as tennis:
examples: I won the first game, and then lost the next two.

definitions.definition: organized sports activities that children do at school:
an organized competition consisting of several different sports events:
the way in which a person plays a particular sport:
examples: Susan is playing golf every day to try to improve her game.

definitions.definition: something that is not treated seriously:
examples: Love is just a game to him.

definitions.definition: willing to do things that are new, difficult, or that involve risks:
examples: It was a difficult challenge, but Roberta was game.
